headline: Extreme Banana Nut Bread 'EBNB'
description: This banana nut bread is extra moist, dense, and delicious. The recipe makes generous loaves packed with banana flavor and studded with walnuts.

video.description: This banana bread is flavorful, moist, and addictive.
video.name: Extreme Banana Nut Bread

name: Extreme Banana Nut Bread 'EBNB'

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease and flour two 9x5-inch loaf pans.
Sift flour, baking soda, and salt into a large bowl.
Cream sugar and butter together in a separate bowl. Stir in bananas, eggs, and walnuts until well blended.
Pour wet ingredients into flour mixture and stir just until blended. Divide the batter evenly between the two prepared pans.
Bake in the preheated oven until a paring knife inserted into the crown of each loaf comes out clean, 60 to 70 minutes.
Remove from the oven and let loaves cool in the pans for at least 5 minutes. Turn out onto a cooling rack, and let cool completely, about 30 minutes.
Slice and serve. For more intense flavor, wrap each loaf in aluminum foil to keep in the moisture, then refrigerate for at least 2 hours before serving.

review.reviewBody: I want to thank you the person that share this recipe. I love this banana bread, I made it a few times and everybody loves it. I make one yesterday, and I decide to share the pics, sometimes I add chocolate chips or cranberries and to this one I add raisins and came out delicious. I save the recipe, this one is my favorite.
This was the easiest recipe I have ever made! It taste really goof. My Goddaughter and I had fun making it. Thank you for sharing!üôèüôè

This is the best recipe for banana nut bread I've ever made. Of course, being from Texas, I use pecans instead of walnuts. Also added 1 tsp vanilla this time, haven't tasted it yet because the loves are still cooling :). I am thinking about increasing it by half so that the loaves aren't so thin, but this may not be a good idea because the increased baking time may make the outside too done. Anyone have any thoughts on this? Mine fall so much and leave such a trench in the middle that I think next time I'll add a tsp. of lemon to help the baking soda do it's job. These are kind if nitpicky things - the main thing is it's a great recipe!
Never disappoints. I do add about a tsp of cinnamon and half a tsp of nutmeg.
Made this using Kirkland unsalted mixed nuts I had on hand. Very delicious.
This is the best banana nut bread, my family loves it!
yum

I have made this recipe several times. I follow the recipe exactly as written with two exceptions I add extra nuts and about 2 tsp of vanilla extract. I also read in the notes or maybe it was review that if you use brown sugar, it makes it better. I think it is a wonderful recipe. It is always moist. I do not separate mine into loaves, I cook in a Bundt pan. I have gotten a great many "mmms" when giving this as a gift. It is my most often requested snack from the grandchildren.
always my go too Banana Nut Bread Recipe! A crowd pleaser for sure.
I simply don't understand the hype. This was the worst banana nut bread I have ever had. Waste of ingredients, effort, and time.
Absolutely wonderful !!!
I used 1cup of white sugar and 1 cup of brown sugar. I added 1/2 to 1tsp cinnamon. This recipe is very delicious as written and also with my little tweaks.

Everyone loved the bread! I made it for a sibling reunion and it was a big hit. Now, everyone has put in their orders for Christmas, so I'm going to be making it again soon. The only thing I did different from the recipe was that I used brown sugar and added vanilla extract to it. Plus, I doubled the recipe and it turned out awesome. Some recipes don't like it when you double it so I was taking a chance, but it turned out really well.
love the recipe Thank you, greetings from Greece
I made it with 2 eggs formula, added 1stp baking powder in refined flour and 1tsp vanilla essence along with given recipe. One of the best cake I made ever
This recipe makes the best BNB I have ever ate. It came out perfect.
Added a few mini chocolate chips for a nice surprise!

The most moist banana nut bread I‚Äôve ever baked and enjoyed. It‚Äôs an amazing bread! Not overly sweet it‚Äôs a perfect bread. I LOVE walnuts and added some on top before placing in oven. I am always asked for the recipe and refer them to allrecipes.com website
Fantastic recipe I added vanilla and cinnamon Plus used more bananas Also did half organic sugar and half brown sugar
This is the best recipe ever! I have made this for several years now and everyone loves it. I add little extra banana and nuts to it but its excellent either way. You can't go wrong with this one.
I tried many banana nut recipes....this is the one for me, moist, delicious easy.

I usually don't change recipes before making them once. But I only had 1 1/2 C banana so I added 1/2 C finally grated yellow squash. You could not taste it. The bread is so moist, rich, tender, dense. This is a keeper!
This is a great recipe. I make it for my friends in Thailand and they love it!!! I don't see how it could be better and I simply followed the directions as written.
This is the bomb diggity!!!
It really is perfect if you follow the instructions to a 'T'. (I live in a very humid climate so I almost always need to add 1 or 2T of AP flour.)
This is the best banana bread I have ever baked...!!!
Made it as is but used the double recipe and one giant loaf it was amazing
Awesome! Wouldn't change a thing! Best banana nut bread I've ever made!
I mixed the walnuts after it was blended
No changes seemed a little sweet before cooking it but afterwards it was just right and moist thank you small town woman.
It was the best. I even added 1 tsp of vanilla flavoring to make the flavor really come out.

I have made this recipe a few times and this recipe turns out absolutely delicious!! I made a couple adjustments though. Instead of two cups of white sugar, I add 1 cup white sugar and 1 cup light brown sugar. I also add an about an extra cup of ripped bananas because it gives it a deeper banana flavor.
My go to banana nut bread! Thanks for sharing Grandma's recipe!

I have made this EBNB dozens of times. It Is FABULOUS! Just a beautiful loaf! It makes a lovely gift too! Be sure to include the recipe-otherwise you'll be asked to make it constantly (trust me I couldn't keep family and friends supplied!). I believe I do one thing differently. I let my banana's get very ripe. I then put the banana in a freezer bag, (measured for one batch) mash them inside the bag, flatten the mashed banana and freeze them (I think it makes the bread a little darker). When it comes time to indulge or I can't take the begging any longer, I can just pull out a bag from my freezer as it defrosts quickly. I'm a little heavy on the nuts too, just how my family enjoys it. I've yet to add any other ingredients such as chocolate chips for example. This recipe is in my permanent cook book now! My kids and grandchildren will remember me for this moist, rich, tender, nutty bread, just as we remember my mother‚Äôs pumpkin pies! Sorry no picture. It doesn't last long enough! Thanks for Sharing the Recipe!
This bread is the best bananna nut bread I have ever had!
Simply DELICIOUS!
This recipe is amazing I love it. Followed the recipe but used equal parts of sugars, which was 1 cup brown sugar and 1 cup white sugar and it's lovely.

EXCELLENT RECIPE!!! I followed the recipe exactly (with the ingredients) as it was almost the same as my Mother‚Äôs and it turned out PERFECTLY! I had to cut back on the baking time to 52 minutes as the loaves were perfectly browned on top and the inside was super moist and flavorful!!! One of the best recipes EVER!!! I think I will make a homemade caramel icing for the next batch as one of the ladies in my hometown church does this and it is DELICIOUS!!! She even bakes the loaves or uses a Bundt pan and freezes a couple that she can thaw, add the icing for family dinners, church homecomings and be one step ahead!!! Thank you so much for posting!!!
It's been some time since I have made banana nut bread, used the recipe last time, delicious, using it now again.
Yup, I pinned itüôÇ. I added 1/2 cup sour cream & 1/2 pkg vanilla pudding. 1 cup brown sugar, 1 cup white sugar. Pecans chopped well, instead of walnuts. 4 bananas. This is to die for. Thank you.
Too sweet! Would use 1.5c sugar next time and add cinnamon.
Awful. A total waste if ingredients. Bread fell during baking. Someone needs to apologize or go back over this recipe. Very upset üò†

Seriously I've made this recipe probably about 50 times. It's hands down the best banana bread recipe. I've done different versions, most recently adding unsweetened coconut, always adding a bunch of cinnamon. It makes a lot which is kind of bad because there's more to eat ü§£ if I could only eat one thing on this earth for the rest of my life, it would be this. I want to be like 90, on my death bed, big hunk of this banana bread as a last meal and ready to peace tf out Earth; happy. Inclusions/toppings I have tried: Blueberries Vanilla Caramel Unsweetened Coconut Chocolate chips Peanut butter chips Peanut butter Strawberries Walnuts Pecans Cashews Cool Whip (flavored with Sugar free Cheesecake instant pudding)
It was great bread. I made no changes. Next time I might try half white sugar and half brown.
THE VERY BEST BANANA CAKE EVER!! AND I HAVE MADE A L0T.a PERFECT BLEND OF INGREDIENTS..LOVED IT..

I have never made this when it didn't get rave reviews. Super moist. Very rich and flavourful. I always use bananas that are so black they're almost oozing. I mash & freeze them so they're ready whenever I need to make a sweet treat to take somewhere. My preference is without nuts. But either way you'll be a bit if you make this!

It was mouth watering delicious, yes,, I made a couple changes ,, I coated the glass bread pans with Carlini cooking spray, then gave all sides and bottom of pan with cinnamon sugar, and topped bread with extra walnuts. It caramelizes the bread and seal in the freshness. We all love it !!
Lots of sugar and butter! With that much sugar, it tends to burn faster.
Love this recipe üòç !! I am making it tonight for the third time !! This time I added blueberries. Anxious for it to come out of the oven !!

The very best banana nut bread ever!! I do as others putting 1tsp baking powder, 1tsp vanilla and 1/2 white sugar 1/2 brown sugar. I have made this at least 10 times. Friends love when I say I‚Äôm making my banana nut bread and yes I say my
I added more nuts. And, I made muffins, not loaves. They cook a little less time, about 35-40 Minutes.
An awesome recipe that we use all the time

I made this months ago & it was the best banana bread I ever had! Im known for sharing my food at work & everyone loved it! Sadly, I forgot to write it in my recipe book so I had to look for it online again & started to panic when I couldn‚Äôt find it. I love how you warn about how you can‚Äôt stop eating it. That‚Äôs when I knew I found the right recipe again! Thank you! This is really the best! Also, i love butter‚Ä¶.
My family and friends can't get enough of this banana bread. They want my recipe but I'm like it a old family secret lol.

I made a few changes based on what I had & making it more diabetic friendly. Used almond flour in place of regular flour, used 1/2 unprocessed sugar & 1/2 maple syrup, added 1 teaspoon vanilla & 1 tsp. Cinnamon + 1/2 tsp. Allspice. Added walnuts & pecans

Made this TWICE today .....1st time my aging eyes deceived me and told me to add 2 cups of butter rather than one. Still couldn't screw it up! 2nd time added the cinnamon, baking powder, extra 1/2 cup walnuts, and halved the sugars between brown and white. Also used cinnamon sugar rather than flour when greasing the pans. YUM!!!! We all are until we were sick to our tummies. A bit too addicting but worth it;!!
Awesome!!!! I added chocolate chips and vanilla but this would have been awesome without them. The crunchy crusty edges are the best!
It turned out perfect! Very moist and nutty. Thanks for sharing!
Excellent!

I made this in my bread machine and loved it! The only problem I had was that it didn't completely bake. I just took the bread basket out of the machine and baked it in the oven for another 30 minutes. It was perfect!
I make this bread for my family a lot, and I can't keep it in my house for more then a day or two at the most. Thank you for sharing it!
made this severall times,i love the density
Great recipe, super easy. Requires lots of mixing bowls. Still in the oven but smells amazing. Debating about keeping one for myself. Makes 2 loaves.
This recipe is sooooooo good. My kids love it too. I add 1 cup of dried chopped dates - yum.

BEST banana bread ever! YES! I also added 1/2 tsp. baking powder, 3:1 ratio brown & white sugar for the 2 cups that's called, 1 tsp vanilla extract and 2 tsp of cinnamon. Don't use more than 2 cups banana, this last try I put a whole extra one in and it was a tad mushy, but kinda good ooey mushy. I also baked it at 340¬∞ instead of 350¬∞. 35 minutes for muffins and 40-50 minutes for small or large pans. I've already eaten 3 muffins and I can't control myself.

This recipie is stupid good. I have made it several times and every time it is like crack banana cocaine. My family was skinny and now they're fat. Make it, sell it, become a billionaire. Do it, just freaking do it.
This bread tastes fantastic, but didn‚Äôt come out clean from the baking dish. Need better method than a greased/floured dish. I was shocked considering the amt of butter. Soooo yummy though.

Very disappointed ...made the bread exactly as directed and both loaves fell hard in the middle. My guys will eat the outer edges but will not use this recipe again. I do a lot of baking and this recipe just does not stand the test.
I added stevia to make it diabetic friendly. Its in the bread machine now. Wish me luck.

My husband couldn‚Äôt give enough ‚Äúyums‚Äù and ate 1/3 of the loaf. I might lessen the sugar just a tad next time; perhaps use only 1-3/4 cups instead of 2 cups. But it was easy and very, very good.
I made this and it turned out great! I normally bake mine in a sheet pan because my family likes thin slices! It is quicker this way as well
I used half dark brown and half white sugar. It's delicious, but more like a cake than a traditional nut bread.

This banana nut bread is spot on delicious. I used olive oil instead of butter. I baked it in an oiled, floured square pan. The banana nut bread was hot when I tasted it, yummy
 I can't wait to taste it when it cools down. I love, love oven banana nut bread

This was the best banana nut bread I've ever made! The last time I made one, my son asked if I ever tried adding chocolate chips so I did. I also swapped some of the white sugar for dark brown sugar and cut the recipe in half (I only have one loaf pan) and it came out perfect in every way. I will definitely use this again. Probably in a day or two lol. That's how good it was.

I‚Äôm not sure what some people issue was. I cut everything in half to make one loaf and after 45 minutes it came out perfect. Of course it would depend on your oven so my suggestion is to just keep an eye on it and do the toothpick test. I also used farm eggs instead of store bought, so not sure if that made a difference or not.
No fail recipe. I have been making it for yrs now. Everyone that eats it loves it. Sometimes I add a cup of chocolate chips and reduce half a cup of sugar. Yum

OK, a colleague forwarded this to me when I shared the recipe I inherited from my grandmother at work. The ingredients are identical (although her base recipe is half of this one - 1 cup of bananas, etc). She received hers from a friend from Hawaii, so in our family we always called this "Hawaiian Banana Bread." I don't know what they call it in Hawaii - probably just banana bread ;)Anyway, the ingredients here are great, but I personally don't like it with nuts. My father makes it with pecans and/or chocolate chips. YMMV. Also, I disagree with the comment that you can substitute any other fat. Yes, technically you can. The results are inferior if you do. Specifically, when I was a kid (and the way I inherited this from Grandma Mary) we used margarine. Transfats aside, the texture and flavor are just worse. Of course butter improves the flavor. it also improves the texture by increasing the difference between the crust and the interior - particularly when warm.

This brings me to another point. I love this warm. It's amazing straight from the oven - I don't agree at all with the comment about leaving it to cool. Yes, it's a bit harder to handle when it is warm - it is so soft in the middle, it will fall apart a bit. But cut it with a good serrated knife and it's fine. What I particularly love about it warm is that you have this crunchy-chewy crust and light, warm middle - the texture plus the aroma plus the taste are a knockout combination.

I've been making this recipe for the last 2 years. Slight changes every time according to what I had on hand. I've added chopped dates, fig preserves, applesauce, chopped walnuts, chopped bittersweet ghirardelli chocolate chips , dark brown sugar, molasses.. 
Always turns out GREAT!
Yes, it Definitely is Addictive. Yes, I admit to hiding it from people so I will make sure to have a slice for work. I get asked to make it ALL the time! 
I used all egg whites 1 time and even that was ok.
The last batch I used the Extra Creamy Tillamook butter and omg! Absolutely Amazing.. Do yourself a favor and try the Tillamook.. Thanks so very much for this PERFECT GUILTY PLEASURE! It deserves the warning you post in the beginning. Lol I'm making a batch right now!
Easy to make and VERY tasty!!
This recipe is perfect, I didn‚Äôt change a single thing..

Was very moist and very good. I cut in half and just made one loaf instead of two. Used half brown and half white sugar, added 1 teaspoon of vanilla and 1/2 teaspoon of cinnamon, and I added some peanut butter chips just because. I will make this again.

This is an incredibly delicious recipe. SUPER EASY to prepare and bake. I place it in a 8x11 Teflon coated pan that I butter up well before placing batter in. My oven runs hot, so I usually take it out of the oven with a clean knife around 35 minutes. I've made this recipe about 8 times and it comes out scrumptious.

it didnt rise. it scorched on bottom and sides of pans at 57 min. @350*
added 1 tsp vanilla, 1 tsp cinn and 1 tsp cloves. Needs baking powder and lower temp on oven... 325*

I got so many compliments on this banana bread. I did modify the recipe a bit.

I substituted 1/2 cup of mashed bananas for 2 of the eggs to boost the banana flavour. 

I used brown sugar instead of white sugar and I reduced it to just 1 cup of sugar.

I also added 1 cup of chocolate chips. 

I served it with some buttercream icing for those that wanted a little more sweetness.

There's not a single piece left, and I've been asked for the recipe by a few people already! I think this is my new favourite recipe!!!

This is by far the best banana nut bread recipe I‚Äôve tried and I‚Äôve been baking >50 years. I altered it a wee bit by: substituting 1C. Erythriol sweetener (zero Kcal) and 1C. Dark brown sugar; 2 tsp. Pure vanilla. The bread required the full 70 minutes bake time. Very moist and flavorful. Soooo good with homemade cream cheese frosting.

I really liked this recipe. During Covid, I‚Äôve been interested in baking and this was among the things I baked. 

This recipe was awesome And I will say that I believe butter is what makes it denser as opposed to margarine. But the taste is wonderful.

Great recipe! I've made it a few times now and the bread is truly moist and spongy. I've made it as muffins and in 9x5 pans. I've made it with brown sugar and canola oil instead of white sugar and butter. I've also made it with white sugar and butter. Another time I made it with one cup brown sugar and one cup white sugar. Each time turned out great.

The recipe is simple enough to make with my 3yo. I added a teaspoon of cinnamon to mine and loved it. 
Definitely pay attention to baking time. My loaves were completely baked in 45min.
This is my 4th time looking up this recipe! It is my go-to for Banana Nut Bread. It is everything it says it is and lasts about 2 days before both loaves are gone!
I like this recipe, it went together well. I used one cup brown sugar and one cup white.
I used 5 bananas and organic sugar. Delicious.

I followed Virginia Sista‚Äôs review and this is actually the best banana bread I have ever tasted. I mixed dry ingredients together separately then the wet ingredients separately. I had like 5 medium super ripe bananas but not totally black bananas though. I added also 2 tsp vanilla extract. Oh also I used cake flour, King Arthur brand in place of regular flour. I used 2 cubes of unsalted butter. My husband and I can‚Äôt have the salt. I only added 1/2 tsp of salt to this. So slowly mix in the dry ingredients into the wet but use an electric hand mixer to mix the wet first before adding the dry always make sure to mix the dry by itself before adding to the wet. I used the electric hand mixer to mix it all up. I slathered butter on a glass bread loaf pan then shook flour around on it then tapped the excess off into the sink. Put half ingredients in each. I have one ceramic bread pan too. That seemed to cook quicker than the glass. I jabbed a knife to make sure it wasn‚Äôt slimy. Then done. A little moist is ok though idk. It was great as f!!k! Thank you!!!!

Followed recipe exactly as written and my bread turned out perfect !! My whole family loved it had to make it again today this time my bananas were not as dark and over ripe as I like them to be when making bread and this batch turned out just as tasty as the first batch. It is a simple recipe easy to make and it is by far the most tasty banana bread I have ever eaten. Thank You for sharing this recipe.
This is definitely the best banana bread recipe ever!! Made it exactly as written except used oil instead of butter!! Thanks for a great recipe!!
Made this tonight and DH couldn't wait for it to cool (never does!). It is the best we have had in years! This recipe is a keeper and an excuse to buy an excessive amount of bananas!

This is amazing, the texture was perfect. I use less sugar (3/4 cup) and it was just lovely. I made it last evening and have none left to submit a photo. We ate first and thought of pics after. Thank you for sharing this lovely recipe
This is the BEST banana bread I have ever made - or eaten. The only change I made was to add chocolate chips because - why not? Next time, with chocolate chips, I would reduce sugar a bit. Terrific!!
This was easy to make and turned out really well. Delicious!
Excellent banana bread!
